title: RigVeda Hymn 07026

Rig Veda, tr. by Ralph T.H. Griffith, [1896], at sacred-texts.com

HYMN XXVI. Indra.

1. SOMA unpressed ne’er gladdened liberal Indra, no juices pressed without a prayer have pleased him.
I generate a laud that shall delight him, new and heroic, so that he may hear us.
2 At every laud the Soma gladdens Indra: pressed juices please him as each psalm is chanted,
What time the priests with one united effort call him to aid, as sons invoke their father.
3 These deeds he did; let him achieve new exploits, such as the priests declare at their libations.
Indra hath taken and possessed all castles, like as one common husband doth his spouses.
4 Even thus have they declared him. Famed is Indra as Conqueror, sole distributer of treasures;
Whose many succours come in close succession. May dear delightful benefits attend us.
5 Thus, to bring help to men, Vasiṣṭha laudeth Indra, the peoples' Hero, at libation.
Bestow upon us strength and wealth in thousands. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

Next: HYMN XXVII. Indra.

data.feecting:
p:SOMA unpressed ne’er gladdened liberal Indra, no juices pressed without a prayer have pleased him.
p: I generate a laud that shall delight him, new and heroic, so that h. May hear us.
p:At every laud the Soma gladdens Indra: pressed juices please him as each psalm is chanted, what time the monks with one united effort call him to aid, as sons invoke their father.
p:These deeds he did; let him achieve new exploits, such as the monks declare at their libations. Indra hath taken and possessed all castles, like as one common husband doth his spouses.
p:Even thus have they declared him. Famed is Indra as Conqueror, sole distributer of treasures. Whose many succours come in close succession. May dear delightful benefits attend us.
p:Thus, to bring help to men, Vasiṣṭha laudeth Indra, the peoples' Hero, at libation. Bestow upon us strength and wealth in thousands. Preserve us evermore, ye Devas, with blessings.
